title: Bangladesh defends Amir and Asif
text: Saturday, 17 October 2015 13:18 Posted by Madiha Shakeel 3 Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) has defended the decision to include tainted Pakistani players Mohammad Asif and Mohammad Amir in the league. According to local media report, administration of BPL has no issue with their participation in the upcoming league and some franchises have shown interest in wanting them. The Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) Governing Council member secretary Ismail Haydar Mollick said, “They had been punished for their wrong deeds and we have enlisted them after they managed the permission of International Cricket Council (ICC)”. Mollick further stated that the BPL has earned a bright name in the cricketing fraternity after punishing their accused players in the match-fixing scandals. During the Indian Premier League, 122 cricketers had been accused of match fixing scandals. But we are the sole authority to punish our cricketers in that regard when the accusation arrived against local cricketers in Bangladesh Premier League. Nearly 200 foreign cricketers have expressed interest in the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL).Pakistani fast bowler Mohammed Amir and Chris Gayle from the West Indies are among the foreigners, along with 182 foreign players including 52 from Pakistan and 48 from England have formally expressed their interest to play this year. The BPL tournament which is going to start next month November 24 in Dhaka, Mohammad Amir has been added to the list of foreign players likely to play BPL. Copyright Business Recorder, 2015
